content:
Hi,
I am trying to get the $everything working to fetch a full patient record. So this works:
http://fhir.example.com/Patient/123/$everything
but I am searching on patient identifier so can anyone help me with syntax for this e.g.
[base]/Patient?identifier=http://fhir.nhs.net/Id/local-identifier|3000&_$everything [NOTE THIS DOES NOT WORK]
no, that doesn't work - it's not part of the way $everything is defined. You have to o it in 2 steps - find the patient by searching for identifier, then use $everything
ok thanks, is there any other way to pull back all the patient details and in my case all Care Provider (Organisation) details in one RESTful query?

I thought that http://fhir.example.com/Patient/123/ would give you everything. provided first that the server supported compartment, and second that the Privacy/Security/Organizational policies allowed it. It is often these policies that will get in your way. This includes policies about streaming too much data back. Isn't this the part of REST definition?
Im not surprised that everyone would have decided that there is no possible policy that would enable this kind of data dump, so they might not have implemented it.

When I do a request such as http://fhir.example.com/Patient/123/ I only get back the data on the Patient record. I have used _elements successfully to only return what I need in other scenarios. So if the Care Provider details were filled in fully then I might get some of the information. It does not then go to the Organization record and also pull that back. I will look into the compartment support. I would have thought $everything would work however you send the query to FHIR.
I think you need to provide more information.... which server are you testing against, and what do you and do you not get in return

I am testing against a HAPI server and as above I want to send the query as follows: [base]/Patient?identifier=http://fhir.nhs.net/Id/local-identifier|3000&_$everything

So I don't have to do a two step process and first get id then get identifier.
At the moment, you can't combine an operation invocation and a search.
you could propose a change to the $everything operation using 'propose a change' at the bottom of every page of the spec
Thanks both, I will certainly propose a change now!
